Key Match Events: Mookie Betts hit a walk-off home run in the ninth inning to give the Dodgers a 6-5 win over the Rockies.
Shohei Ohtani and Mookie Betts hit back-to-back home runs in the ninth inning.
Shohei Ohtani hit his 53rd home run of the season.
Kiké Hernández hit a two-run homer in the seventh inning.
Freddie Freeman hit an RBI single in the seventh inning.
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Dave Roberts emphasized the importance of strong bullpen performance and the need to win the game to maintain their division lead.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Dave Roberts expressed pride and relief after the win, stating it felt like two wins.
Mookie Betts acknowledged the urgency of the situation and the importance of the win.
Dave Roberts highlighted the significance of the victory in maintaining their division lead and the potential for a first-round bye in the playoffs.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Yoshinobu Yamamoto struggled with his mechanics, leading to a four-run, three-inning start.
The Dodgers' offense left 11 of their 13 baserunners stranded, going one for nine with runners in scoring position.
The Dodgers' bullpen delivered a six-inning effort, including three innings of one-run ball from rookie Ben Casparius.
Tony Gonsolin remains a potential option for the Dodgers' postseason pitching staff as he continues his recovery from Tommy John surgery.
